ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: With NABARDs assistance VECT NGO is promoting JLGs in 6 Blocks of Krishnagiri District in Support with Indian Bank, Bank of India and Syndicate Bank. With the assistance from NABARD we have organised Financial Literacy Awareness Programs in Krishnagiri Dist. In coordination with the Department of Horticulture we are organising Farmers Producer Organisation of Mango Growers in 6 Blocks of Krishnagiri district by forming FPO in these blocks

sourceOfFunds.purpose: Objectives of the project.: • To Increase awareness on reducing land degradation among villagers, SHG members, youth and school students. • To promote the habit of adopting multiple cropping practice. • To promote bio pesticides, bio-fertilizers and vermin compost • To encourage farmers to take up rainwater harvesting.

The source of income of the people is mainly from agriculture. But due to failure of monsoon rain they are unable to run the family. Keeping this in view we intend to give training to the rural SHG women in Non Farm Activity like Apparel Designing; there by creating an alternate source of income to them.

The Program will enable the students to understand the needs and benefits of the products and services offered by the banks. It will enable the transition from poverty to financial empowerment The programme will create awareness about money, importance of savings, advantages of saving with banks, other facilities provided by banks and benefits of borrowing from banks

Formation of JLG and link them with the bank for getting financial assistance will play a significant role in the rural economy by providing gainful employment to a large number of small, marginal farmers and landless agricultural labourers and raising their economic status. Livestock form an important resource next to family labour for the landless agricultural labourers and is the only major asset for them.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Vivekananda Yoga Anusandhana Samsthana or in short VYASA is a registered society under the Karnataka Societies Registration Act to bring the holistic vision of yoga and spiritual lore as a way of life. Yoga as a way of life would bring health and wealth, peace and efficiency, harmony and growth to solve the problems of the modern society and to build ideal social orders. To make yoga, one of the greatest contributions of India to world thought and culture, a socially relevant science has been the endeavor of the Society. For making this possible, we follow the direction given by the great saint Vivekananda who pronounced that we need to combine the best of the West (modern scientific research) with the best of the East (Yoga and spiritual lore) to bring a grand harmony and peace on earth.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: The YR Gaitonde Medical, Educational and Research Foundation (1985), an internationally recognized non-profit in Chennai pioneers HIV prevention, care and research through the YRG Center for AIDS Research and Education (YRGCARE). The Foundationâ€™s livelihood initiative â€˜ECO Kitchenâ€™ addresses economic stability within families affected by social and economic challenges. Dr Suniti Solomon, Founder, and her team at Madras Medical College, documented first evidence of HIV in India (1986). YRGCAREâ€™s expertise includes HIV clinical care for over 19000 patients living with HIV, outreach prevention services, a NABL accredited laboratory, medical and counseling training and clinical, laboratory and behavioural research. Services: HIV, sexuality, treatment education; anonymous testing for HIV/STI; healthcare and support; matrimonial services; reproductive health; pediatric care and therapeutic recreation camps for children with HIV; and clinics for MSM and IDUs. ECO Kitchenâ€™s Project ECO (Enhancing Community Opportunities) has four components. Kathir: innovative food retail micro-entrepreneurship supporting disadvantaged women and their families; Kathir Dhan: responds to hunger and malnutrition, building bridges between those in need and those who wish to help; Out-of-the-Box: serves personalized meals-corporate pantries and private catering events, employs women as food service agents; Endrum Punnagai: helps children at schools (Corporation of Chennai) to enhance health, self-confidence and interpersonal communication.

sourceOfFunds.purpose: Build a rural community outreach model to address the complex needs of rural HIV prevention, care and support requirements in Ludhiana, a high prevalence / highly vulnerable district. The Link Worker Scheme (LWS) is a medium term, meso-level strategy, whose scope is limited to five years. The services established through the link worker scheme will be linked to local health governance system at three levels. This will again ensure mainstreaming of the HIV response project
